column5: Exactly what is a "shield lake" ? Thanks, Paul
Glacier carved rock shorelines, pine trees, little to no top soil. Basically...http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canadian_Shield
World Class Fishing LOL!!Thank you,Larry Mac

The Canadian shield is simply the common name of the massive igneous (volcanic) rock that covers the region. This is some of the oldest known rock on earth. It also extends into Northern Minnesota and Wisconsin. Shield lakes are known for their rugged rocky out crops made of the same material they lay upon. For the most part these lakes are oligotrophic lakes (cool clear-stained, low nutrient with decent dissolved oxygen at depth) that we scraped out when the glaciers advanced and retreated. The end result was some of the best fresh water fishing on the planet. good luck GF

One of the world's largest geologic continental shields, centred on Hudson Bay and extending for 8,000,000 square km (3,000,000 square miles) over eastern, central, and northwestern Canada from the Great Lakes to the Canadian Arctic and into Greenland, with small extensions into northern Minnesota, Wisconsin, Michigan, and New York, U.S.
